summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to United Airlines Corporate Security, demanding passenger and other records for Ghislaine Maxwell for two time periods (1994-1998 and July 2019 onward). The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney / Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and accompanying cover letter requesting records from United Airlines and non-disclosure of the subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena demands all United Airlines records (passenger, payment, membership, etc.) for her for the periods January 1, 1994 through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019 through the date of service. Also listed with an alias (Ghislaine Borgerson) and date of birth.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, is issuing a grand jury subpoena to obtain travel and financial records related to Maxwell as part of a criminal investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance for United Airlines
events.description: United Airlines Corporate Security is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury in New York to testify and produce records, though a personal appearance is not required if records are produced with a custodian declaration.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to United Airlines for records on Ghislaine Maxwell, with a request for non-disclosure.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Atollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell as of January 2020, seeking her United Airlines travel and financial records from 1994-1998 and from July 2019 onward.

The subpoena cites federal criminal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy), indicating the nature of the investigation.
The government explicitly requested United Airlines not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document confirms Ghislaine Maxwell used an alias, Ghislaine Borgerson, and provides her date of birth as December 25, 1961.
